examples.sentence: The clinkant coins filled his purse.
examples.translation: チャリンチャリンと音を立てるコインが彼の財布を満たした。

etymology.value: From Middle English, present participle of clinken (“to clink, ring”), equivalent to clink + -ant.

usage_notes.explanation: This word is obsolete and rarely encountered in modern English.

readability_explanation.text: This is an obsolete word, so it is not part of common vocabulary. It is unlikely to be encountered outside of historical texts.
